title: .NET Specialist
description:
**We are looking for a passionate driven developer that is skilled in Snowflake architecture, integrations and in the C# & .NET framework. You will join the Energy Efficiency & Weight Digital team, where we will set up a new sub-team to manage the Battery Passport. The Energy Efficiency & Weight team delivers digital solutions that support in leading automotive sustainability innovations, as well as ensure that all our cars are following all market regulations and legislation. We use modern tools and agile methods to create business value continuously. We ensure high quality and adaptability in our delivery.**


### **Assignment Description**


* You will work in a small, cross-functional, empowered team.
* It is expected that you contribute to all stages in the development process, from creating requirements to putting code in production.
* This means you need to be able to work with solutions independently and in a team.
* In this assignment you will be part of building new solutions, as well as integrating data from and to existing applications, as well as integrating with other data sources in the Snowflake architecture.
* You will build brand new, modern digital solutions and you will work with already existing ones.

  


**Required Skills**


* You are an experienced software engineer with a genuine drive to solve problems and you have a servant mindset in the team.
* It is important that you are passionate about what you do, have a high interest in keeping up with current best practices & know and care about sound engineering practices like continuous delivery and emphasis on automated testing to support production ready code every day.
* You are passionate about crafting clean code & are experienced working with modern infrastructure and tools.
* You are experienced and comfortable collaborating directly with end-users when developing new functions and features.
* You are experienced in working in Snowflake architecture.
* You are experienced in working with integrations between different systems and/or data sources.
* You have experience with .NET, C#, React, Azure cloud services and Git.
* Proficient with relational databases as well as analytical databases like OLAP systems
* Good understanding of data modeling best practices for transactional and analytical use-cases.
* Strong understanding of CD, automated testing, and DevOps principles.
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker.

title: Software Developer
description:
**We are looking for an experienced Python Backend Developer with a robust understanding of Azure cloud services, microservices architecture and automation. ShotGrid Autodesk integration will be considered a strong advantage. The ideal candidate will be possess experience with CI/CD deployments and Azure DevOps for project management. Familiarity with the ShotGrid platform and its integration into backend services will be regarded as a strong asset. We’re looking for a high-energy developer with a positive attitude to join our dynamic and active team.**


### **Responsibilities**


* Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient backend services using Python.
* Utilize Azure cloud services to deploy, manage, and scale applications, ensuring consistent performance across different environments.
* Implement microservices architecture to enable modular and maintainable systems.
* Utilize Docker to create, deploy, and manage containerized applications, ensuring consistency and reliability.
* Implement CI/CD pipelines for automated build, test, and deployment processes, contributing to improved development efficiency and product quality.
* Integrate ShotGrid Autodesk into backend workflows to enhance project tracking and collaboration.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including frontend developers, pipeline developers, DevOps engineers, and project managers, to deliver high-quality solutions on time.


**Required Skills**


* Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience with Python and backend development frameworks.
* Familiarity with Azure cloud services, including Azure Functions, CosmosDB, and Azure Service Bus.
* Comprehensive understanding of microservices architecture and principles.
* Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes, such as Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or similar platforms.


**Desired Skills**


* Experience with ShotGrid Autodesk and its integration into backend systems.
* A strong passion for automation and process improvement.
* Proficiency in Docker containers, including creating, deploying, and managing containerized applications using Docker CLI and Docker Compose.


**Technical Skills**


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related.
* Professional experience in frontend development.

title: Applikationsspecialist
description:
**Applikationsspecialist**
==========================


Sista ansökningsdatum: 9 oktober

Svenska kraftnät är en av de viktigaste aktörerna för en hållbar energiomställning. Som applikationsspecialist erbjuds du ett av Sveriges viktigaste IT-jobb, i vilket du varje dag kommer att bidra till Sveriges elförsörjning. Vi behöver dig för att lyckas med vårt samhällsviktiga uppdrag att elektrifiera Sverige.



Vi är i dag ca 500 personer inom IT och vi kommer att växa ytterligare de kommande åren. Detta för att kunna skapa förutsättningar för Sverige att kunna fördubbla sin elproduktion och nå klimatmålen genom att helt ställa om till fossilfri energi. För att lyckas kommer vi att använda oss av den senaste tekniken för att öka kapaciteten i vår infrastruktur och samtidigt öka utvecklingstakten kring system, digitalisering och processer.



Vill du jobba och utvecklas i en växande organisation och tillsammans med underbara medarbetare skapa en framåtlutad och robust IT-organisation, sök dig till oss!


**Om tjänsten**
---------------



För att stärka vår förvaltning och utvecklingsgrupp söker vi en applikationsspecialist. I rollen får du möjlighet att ta ansvar för navet i våra integrations- och kommunikationssystem för informationsutbyte för Svenska kraftnät.



Vårt team, som ligger under IT-utvecklingsavdelningen, består idag av 23 engagerade och glada personer där flertalet ingår i ett integrationskompetenscenter med roller som analytiker, testare, utvecklare, IT-specialister och arkitekter.



Som applikationsspecialist kommer du tillsammans med dina kollegor ansvara för nuvarande applikationsdrift och vara med att driva utvecklingen av nästa generations kommunikationstjänster.



Tjänsten kommer även att innefatta:


* Arbete med integrering av marknadsdata för både interna och externa system.
* Agilt arbete i ett team som är lyhörda för nya arbetssätt.
* Drift, underhåll och vidareutveckling av våra kommunikation och integrationsplattformar.


Du kommer att få möjligheten att utvecklas inom ovanstående område och utbyta erfarenheter med kollegor som verkat länge inom branschen. Det är en möjlighet för dig att vara en del av en komplex och minst sagt spännande miljö där nya tekniker och arbetsmetoder driver vår verksamhet framåt.



Tjänsten kan innebära schemalagd arbetstid mellan intervallet klockan 07.00-18.00 under vissa veckor på huvudkontoret i Sundbyberg. I tjänsten ingår också schemalagd beredskap (från hemmet), ungefär var 6:e vecka.


**Om dig**
----------


*Personliga egenskaper*



Du har god samarbetsförmåga och är mån om att skapa goda långsiktiga relationer med andra. Kvalitetsmedvetenhet och analysförmåga är egenskaper vi också värderar högt. Du är van att ta egna initiativ och kan bidra till vårt team med positiv inställning och humor. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.


*Skallkrav*  

Vi ser att du har en examen inom systemvetenskap eller motsvarande kompetens förvärvad på annat sätt, t.ex. genom utbildning på yrkeshögskola eller arbete inom området.



Vidare har du erfarenhet av:


* Linux/Unix, skriptning och installationer.
* IT-drift av verksamhetskritiska applikationer och plattformar.
* Drift av kommunikationsintensiva system, t.ex. integrationsplattformar och BI-system.
* Kunskap om containerteknologi, t.ex. Kubernetes, Openshift.
* Du har goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


*Meriterande*  

Har du dessutom erfarenhet av något eller flera av följande blir vi superglada:


* CI/CD Pipelines.
* DevOps ramverk som Azure DevOps, GitLab, Ansible eller liknande.
* Messageing som t.ex. Kafka, JMS och AMQP.
* Agila arbetssätt som Scrum och Kanban.

**Bra att veta**
----------------


* Tjänsten är placerad i Sundbyberg.
* Viss möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %.
* Enstaka resor i tjänsten kan förekomma.
* Sista ansökningsdag är den 9 oktober 2024. Vi tar inte emot personligt brev i samband med din ansökan.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.


Kontakta gärna rekryterande chef Magnus Kjellme, 070 291 37 23, alternativt ansvarig rekryterare Victoria Waltenberg, 010 350 90 45. Fackliga representanter är Annika Ingeborn, SACO, 010 475 87 72 och Mikael Hedenheim, ST, 010 475 84 68. Du når oss också via e-post: fornamn.efternamn@svk.se.



#LI-DNI


**Övrig information**
---------------------


Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kommer en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) att genomföras i de fall befattningen innebär hantering av säkerhetsskyddsklassificerade uppgifter eller deltagande i säkerhetskänslig verksamhet. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och, i vissa fall, en särskild personutredning. För anställning på Svenska kraftnät krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Med anställningen följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras.
För mer information om säkerhetsprövning Svenska kraftnät arbetar för att främja mångfald och motverka diskriminering och ser gärna sökanden med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter till våra rekryteringar. Lär känna Svenska kraftnät och hur det är att arbeta hos oss: Lär känna oss på Svenska kraftnät

title: Platform Engineer - Strömmad data/eventdrivenhet
description:
Med 2 miljoner kunder och störst andel av alla avslut på Stockholmsbörsen hanterar vi stora mängder data. I rollen som plattformsutvecklare med fokus på Kafka blir du en viktig del i vår vision att skapa en bättre framtid för miljontals människor!
  
  

Om rollen och teamet
  
Som en del av Team Datadistribution kommer du arbeta tillsammans med 5 erfarna kollegor med att utveckla en data- och tjänstearkitektur som gör det enklare för våra 35+ utvecklingsteam att dela och analysera data. Vi arbetar med java i en mikrotjänstarkitektur och ansvarar för vår Kafka-baserade dataarkitektur. Vi kommer även att flytta delar av, eller hela, vårt Kafka-kluster från vår on-prem setup till molnet och teamet har en central del i detta.
  
  

Teamet har frihet att själva driva sin teknik, och vi värdesätter en miljö med korta beslutsvägar och starkt teamarbete.
  
  

**Ett urval av arbetsuppgifter:**  

Vidareutveckla arkitektur, konfiguration, infrastruktur och lösningsdesign.
  
Designa och förbättra Avanzas övergripande dataarkitektur.
  
Ha inflytande över teknikval inom dataplattformen.
  
Bygga CI/CD-pipelines och stödja DevOps-processer för att säkerställa smidig integration och distribution.
  
Utveckla och designa plattformsarkitektur med fokus på att tillhandahålla verktyg, tjänster och ramverk som underlättar och effektiviserar arbetet för våra interna utvecklingsteam
  
  

Din profil
  
Vi tror att du gillar att samarbeta med andra utvecklare och trivs med att arbeta agilt. Du är serviceinriktad och motiveras av att förbättra Dev-X upplevelsen för kollegor, samt tror att du är strukturerad och kvalitetsmedveten. En fördel är att gilla komplex problemlösning och vara nyfiken att testa nya arbetssätt och metoder.
  
  

**Vi tror också att du:**  

Är väl bekant med programmering på Java-plattformen
  
Kan debugga komplexa kodbaser och har erfarenhet av systemutvecklingens livscykel.
  
Har byggt ramverk eller API som används av andra utvecklare.
  
Har erfarenhet av arkitektur i cloudmiljö
  
Goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
  
  

**Meriterande:**  

Har erfarenhet av Kafka ur ett DevOps- eller operationsperspektiv
  
Har arbetat med CI/CD och har förståelse för DevOps-metodik.
  
Erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med liknande övergångar från on-prem till molnet
  
  

**Ansökan:**  

Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast då urvalet sker löpande, dock senast den 27 Oktober. Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mejl p.g.a. GDPR.
  
  

Välkommen med din ansökan!
  
  

Erbjudanden från rekryteringsföretag/annonssäljare undanbedes.
  
  

/#LI-DNI
  
  

Om företaget
  
  

Avanza är Sveriges ledande internetbank för sparande och placeringar. Vi drivs av att förändra branschen genom att utmana de stora bankerna och försäkringsbolagen på den svenska sparmarknaden. Vi vill vara tjänsten som förenklar och förbättrar spararnas ekonomi, oavsett om man älskar aktier eller bara vill ha ett bra sparande. Vår vision är att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor. Därför står våra kunders bästa alltid i fokus, precis som det borde vara. Affärsidén är enkel – mer till dig, mindre till banken. En idé som gett oss Sveriges nöjdaste sparare 14 år i rad.
  
  

Henrik Jardehag | Kontaktperson
company_description: Med visionen om att skapa en bättre framtid för miljoner människor går vi till jobbet för att skapa billigare, bättre och enklare produkter och tjänster för våra kunder!

title: Business Analyst
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.


At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for a Business Analyst to join our team.


We need technical hands-on Business Analyst with project experience in -


* Large projects on Enterprise Data Platforms support Advance Analytics
* Drive requirement workshops, product demonstrations, capable of translating business requirements to technical specifications
* Ability to converse with technical team to drive seamless product development
* Building Advance Analytics Use Cases (AI/ML)
* Azure Cloud & Databricks with some exposure to Azure DevOps/MLOps,
* Overall Big data, Datalake & Datawarehouse
* Using/developing SQL (for requirement analysis, data analysis and data testing),
* Working with projects having ETL Data integration tools like (Informatica or AbInitio) with any involvement in ETL testing, Additional exposure/understanding of KAFKA
* Working in Scrum and SAFe (including PI planning)
* Strong presentation skills & stakeholder management
* Good Social, collaboration & networking skills
* fluent in English, written & oral

**What you can expect**


* Become part of a the ‘flag ship’ success story - *We go through enormous growth!*
* Based in the Nordics– we have offices Sweden, Norway and Denmark within an European and Global network
* Organization driven by technology – *We have a tremendous technology backbone*
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conform benefits
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666
company_description: Cognizant helps companies modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they stay ahead in a fast-changing world.

title: Engineering Manager
description:
**Xensam:** SAM DisruptersXensam is the leading provider of AI-powered, cloud-hosted Software Asset Management technology. We’re looking for key players to join us as we scale our impact and build the Xensam team together. We take our culture seriously and strive to maintain the excellence, energy & enthusiasm that flows through the organization today.
  
We look for candidates who are passionate about what they do and ready to work the Xensam way. We know that experience counts, but we also know that it’s you, the person behind the experience, that makes it count.
  
About the roleWe are seeking an experienced Engineering Manager to lead and manage our diverse R&D teams, including DBAs, ensuring that all projects align with business values and are completed on time. The ideal candidate will focus on enhancing productivity, quality, meeting deadlines, and coaching team members across various departments.
  
This role requires technical knowledge and experience but will mainly be about managing people, and not the product.
  
Responsibilities
  
**Department Management:** Oversee and coordinate the activities of various R&D departments, including software development, quality assurance, security engineering, DevOps/infrastructure, and database teams.
  
**Productivity and Deadlines:** Ensure teams meet productivity goals and project deadlines while aligning with business objectives.
  
**Staff Development:** Conduct one-on-one meetings, provide coaching, take part in recruitment, and manage staff development to foster a high-performing team environment. Build and scale teams, both on-site and remote. This would include some traveling to other countries.
  
**Collaboration with Product Managers:** Oversee product managers running individual teams to ensure cohesive project execution and alignment with company goals.
  
**Performance Monitoring:** Implement metrics to monitor team performance, quality and productivity, identifying areas for improvement and help develop processes and best practice.
  
**Stakeholder Communication:** Maintain open communication with stakeholders to ensure project alignment with business values.
  
  

Qualifications
  
Proven experience as an Engineering Manager or in a similar leadership role managing cross-functional teams.
  
Strong leadership skills with a focus on team development, coaching, quality and productivity.
  
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
  
Ability to manage multiple departments and projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment.
  
Experience in coaching and mentoring technical staff.
  
Bachelor's degree in Engineering or related field or equivalent technical experience such as prior work as a software developer.
  
Strong verbal and written communication skills in fluent English and Swedish.
  
  

What we offer
  
A dynamic role that focuses on "freedom under responsibility"
  
3 days in-office schedule (remote Mondays & Fridays)
  
A generous work culture with free access to beverages & snacks, gym, bi-weekly massages at the office, shuffleboard, and other games etc.
  
If sales targets are met, an annual destination trip awaits all employees
  
Work with a diverse group driven by ambition as well as having fun together with different activities
  
Great opportunity to influence your career development as well as the company's
  
Work with the latest technology in the fastest-growing SAM software in the market
  
  

**At Xensam, our core values define our workplace atmosphere:**  

REBELLIOUS We foster a rebellious spirit, promoting freedom within responsibilities and encouraging initiative.
  
HUMANE Our team promotes a caring, inclusive environment where diversity is valued, and individuals are respected and empowered to be themselves.
  
HARMONIOUS We prioritize harmony, valuing work-life balance, and creating a pleasant atmosphere.
  
Join Xensam for a balanced, collaborative, and caring workplace. If you're a team player eager to grow professionally, APPLY now!

title: Integration Specialist
description:
**Company Description** ***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***


At Sobi, each person brings their unique talents to work as a team and make a difference. We are dedicated to developing and delivering innovative therapies to improve the lives of people who live with a rare disease. Our edge comes from our team of people and our commitment to patients.


Here at Sobi, our mission and culture get us excited to come to work every day, but here are a few more reasons to join our team:

* Competitive compensation for your work
* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments

 **Job Description**  

 The main responsibilities of the role include:

* Design, implement, and maintain automation and integration solutions for various IT and business processes, such as deployment, testing, and monitoring.
* Work closely with other team members to understand the requirements and challenges of systems, processes and identify opportunities for automations and integrations using Azure integration services.
* Developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines for software delivery using Azure DevOps.
* Automating infrastructure provisioning and management using Azure services and PowerShell scripting.
* Monitoring and troubleshooting issues in production environments on Azure.
* Collaborating with development teams and operations teams to improve software delivery processes.
* Ensuring high availability and performance of production systems on Azure.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Strong experience with Azure cloud platform and its services.
* Experience with integration tools and frameworks, such as Azure Integration Services
* Experience with Azure DevOps for CI/CD and developing using Bicep language for deploying Azure resources.
* Experience with infrastructure as code.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell.
* Proficiency in C# programming language.
* Familiarity with MS SQL or Cosmos DB.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills

  

**Additional Information**  

All Sobi employees need to demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership. Are you ready to be on the Sobi team? Come join a culture that empowers every person to be the person that makes a difference for rare disease.

**Why Join Us?**  

  

We are a global company with over 1,700 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.  

  

We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.  

  

**Sobi Culture**  

  

At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases, and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.  

  

As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

**An Equal Opportunity Employer**  

  

Sobi is an Equal Opportunity Employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. All employment decisions at Sobi are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veterans and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status or protected groups by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.
company_description: Our mission here at Sobi is to develop and deliver innovative therapies and services to improve life for people living with rare diseases.

title: System Architect
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

The RAN Service Traffic Control SW Production & DevX is focusing on the infrastructure of tools and services required to develop applications. It consists of design environments, Continuous Integration pipelines (CI flow) and Test Environments, enabling the development teams to deliver quality assured code to be deployed on both native and cloud-based execution platforms. The infrastructure itself is multifaceted, and lower layers are handled and developed in cooperation with and by other organizations within Ericsson to enable reuse and sharing.  

  

Want to be part of the coolest team in Ericsson? Imagine possible!  

Is professionalism, respect, perseverance and integrity important - it is for us, the values represent what we stand for as a company, and they guide and inspire us in everything we do.  

We are now looking for a Senior Developer in PDU TC Production, with focus on Development Environment and CI machinery. Working with our production system architecture, system studies and where development task and investigation of our flows in operations are a natural part. We are proud to build our Production environment with the same WoW as we do when delivering our product code using a CI/CD DevOps spirit with hardworking system developers with an innovative attitude.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Drive technical studies
* Create, drive requirements including participate in development of the module CI machinery
* Perform trouble shooting and internal customer support in the CI flows
* Drive continuous improvements of CI machinery products and processes
* You will drive strategic technical leadership and perform continuous analysis and requirement handling.
* Develop competence in technical domain

 **Extra meriting is experience in:**

  

* IT service management
* IT operations
* Experience as a system architect and technical driver

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* Domain experience: GIT/Gerrit, Jenkins, Cloud technologies, C/C++/Erlang/Python/Perl
* Programming experience of at least 5 years
* Area of interest: Continuous Integration, Automatic Build, Continuous Delivery and Operation, Docker, Kubernetes
* Working with people and networking
* Innovating, adapting and responding to change
* Delivering results and meeting customer expectations

  

Location: Linköping, **Sweden**

 **Vetting including references and relevant background screening will be conducted for final candidates.**

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Linköping
